headline: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Dillard's, Twilio, Ford Motor, Apple & more
summary: One of Warren Buffett's top lieutenants buys into Dillard's. Twitter gets a boost from an analyst upgrade.

headline: Southwest is expanding in United hubs in Houston and Chicago
summary: Southwest Airlines announced a surprise move into Houston and Chicago's largest airports, a strategy shift that would expand it's presence in United hubs.

headline: Watch live: World Health Organization holds a press briefing on the ongoing coronavirus outbreak
summary: "There are no new answers,"  Dr. Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, said on Friday. "We know what we need to do."

headline: Facebook reverses stance on Holocaust denial, will ban it now
summary: Facebook announced in a blog post Monday it will ban content that "denies or distorts the Holocaust" in a reversal of its earlier stance.
A sharply divided Senate Judiciary Committee opened confirmation hearings for Judge Amy Coney Barrett, President Donald Trump's Supreme Court pick.
headline: Divided senators open Amy Coney Barrett confirmation hearings with focus on health care: 'This is probably not about persuading each other'
'Get long' — Cramer sees coronavirus trends driving stocks higher no matter who wins election
summary: "There are enough trends out there, established by Covid, that just say, 'Get long. And the No. 1, of course, is the internet just plowing through," CNBC's Jim Cramer said on Monday.
The Nest Thermostat has a completely new design that looks less clunky. Instead of rotating the face of the unit, you just touch and swipe down the side to increase or decrease the temperature.
headline: Google announces new Nest Thermostat that uses radar to detect when you're nearby
Dillard's jumps 15% after one of Buffett's investing lieutenants discloses personal stake
summary: Dillard's pops after Berkshire Hathaway investment manager discloses personal stake.

headline: Dr. Scott Gottlieb: U.S. could never coronavirus test as much as China but it must get better
summary: "I'm not saying we need to go that far, but we're a long way from even having some level of compliance around testing and tracing," the former FDA chief told CNBC on Monday.
Banks unofficially kick off the third-quarter earnings season this week. One company’s report should set the tone, according to Piper Sandler's Craig Johnson.
headline: Watch this bellwether banking stock as third-quarter earnings season kicks off

summary: The deal is expected to close by the end of the year.
headline: Twilio stock jumps in premarket on $3.2 billion Segment acquisition

summary: Regulators in the EU are reportedly drawing up a list of around 20 tech giants that they want to comply with tougher rules.
headline: Apple, Google and Facebook could reportedly be put on EU 'hit list'

summary: Southwest Airlines' pilots union scoffed at a company proposal to cut pay rates 10% in exchange for no furloughs through 2022.
headline: Southwest pilots' union bristles at 10% pay cut proposal
Digital tax conflicts could wipe more than 1% off global GDP every year, OECD warns
summary: The OECD has warned that countries need to come to an agreement over digital tax or risk damaging the global economy further.
Lawmakers from countries within the Five Eyes alliance have urged tech firms to develop backdoors that allows them to access encrypted messages.
headline: U.S., UK and other countries warn tech firms that encryption creates 'severe risks' to public safety

summary: General Electric is likely to make good on Goldman Sachs' call for 50% upside, says Michael Binger, president of Gradient Investments.
headline: General Electric's stock is a buy, trader says after analyst calls it the 'ultimate self-help' story
U.K. Pandemic Jobs Data Face Revisions as ONS Tweaks Methodology
Chinese shoppers spend big during the Golden Week holidays — a sign consumption is on the mend
summary: Consumers in the world's second-largest economy clearly still have cash to spend, even if China as a whole is still recovering from the economic shock of the coronavirus pandemic.

headline: China hands out $1.5 million of its digital currency in one of the country's biggest public tests
summary: China has started one of the biggest real-world trials for its digital currency as it pushes closer toward creating a cashless future.

headline: An app that let Chinese users bypass the Great Firewall and access Google, Facebook has disappeared
summary: An app that briefly gave Chinese internet users access to foreign websites such as YouTube and Facebook — services that have long been blocked — has now disappeared.
